intro: Arctogeron, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. These plants are typically herbaceous, with some species exhibiting a semi-woody growth habit. Arctogeron species are native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere, often found in woodland or meadow habitats. They are valued in horticulture for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
